alert.note: Alert for Iberia; Lafayette; St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 8:28PM CDT until August 25 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN IBERIA, LAFAYETTE AND NORTHWESTERN ST. MARTIN PARISHES... At 828 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain are diminishing across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area, and flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lafayette, Scott, Breaux Bridge, Carencro, St. Martinville, Broussard, Youngsville, Duson, Henderson, Cade, Coteau, Cecilia, Acadiana Regional Airport, Ridge, Parks and Milton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
